summary: Load tests fail intermittently due to DEADLINE EXCEEDED errors on query requests in the TypeScript SDK. Investigation revealed the root cause was a server-side query timeout issue, which was fixed upstream. Test stability was also improved by tuning down cached workflow limits.
userImpact: Users running load tests experience intermittent failures due to query timeouts, making CI/CD pipelines unreliable.
rootCause: Server-side bug in query implementation causing timeouts on sticky worker queries, fixed in temporalio/temporal#2033
proposedFix: Tune down the number of cached workflows to stabilize builds; server-side fix applied upstream
workaround: Retrying queries was attempted but proved unreliable as it could also result in timeouts
resolutionDetails: Root cause fixed in upstream Temporal server (PR #2033). Stability improved by tuning cached workflow limits.
keyQuote: The occasional DEADLINE EXCEEDED on query requests is a server issue which was fixed here: https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/pull/2033
